verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of Agur <S%H94><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jakeh, <S%H3348><s%> the oracle: <S%H4853><s%> the man <S%H1397><s%> says <S%H5002><s%> to Ithiel, <S%H384><s%> to Ithiel <S%H384><s%> and Ucal: <S%H401><s%>
"Surely I am the most ignorant <S%H1198><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> and don't <S%H376><s%> have a man's understanding. <S%H998><s%>
I have not learned <S%H3925><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> neither do I have <S%H3045><s%> the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the Holy One. <S%H6918><s%>

Who has ascended up <S%H5927><s%> into heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and descended? <S%H3381><s%> Who has gathered <S%H622><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> in his fists? <S%H2651><s%> Who has bound <S%H6887><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> in his garment? <S%H8071><s%> Who has established <S%H6965><s%> all the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth? <S%H776><s%> What is his name, <S%H8034><s%> and what is his son <S%H1121><s%>'s name, <S%H8034><s%> if you know? <S%H3045><s%>
"Every word <S%H565><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is flawless. <S%H6884><s%> He is a shield <S%H4043><s%> to those who take refuge in him. <S%H2620><s%>
Don't <S%H3254><s%> you add to his words, <S%H1697><s%> lest he reprove <S%H3198><s%> you, <S%H3576><s%> and you be found a liar.
"Two <S%H8147><s%> things I have asked <S%H7592><s%> of you; <S%H4513><s%> don't deny me before I die: <S%H4191><s%>

Remove far <S%H7368><s%> from me falsehood <S%H7723><s%> and lies. <S%H1697><s%> Give <S%H5414><s%> me neither poverty <S%H7389><s%> nor riches. <S%H6239><s%> Feed <S%H2963><s%> me with the food <S%H3899><s%> that is needful for me; <S%H2706><s%>

lest I be full, <S%H7646><s%> deny <S%H3584><s%> you, <S%H559><s%> and say, <S%H3068><s%> 'Who is Yahweh?' or lest I be poor, <S%H3423><s%> and steal, <S%H1589><s%> and so dishonor <S%H8610><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of my God. <S%H430><s%>
"Don't <S%H3960><s%> slander a servant <S%H5650><s%> to his master, <S%H113><s%> lest he curse <S%H7043><s%> you, <S%H816><s%> and you be held guilty.
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> that curses <S%H7043><s%> their father, <S%H1><s%> and doesn't <S%H1288><s%> bless their mother. <S%H517><s%>
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> that is pure <S%H2889><s%> in their own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> yet are not washed <S%H7364><s%> from their filthiness. <S%H6675><s%>
There is a generation, <S%H1755><s%> oh how lofty <S%H7311><s%> are their eyes! <S%H5869><s%> Their eyelids <S%H6079><s%> are lifted up. <S%H5375><s%>

There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> whose teeth <S%H8127><s%> are like swords, <S%H2719><s%> and their jaws <S%H4973><s%> like knives, <S%H3979><s%> to devour <S%H398><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> from the earth, <S%H776><s%> and the needy <S%H34><s%> from among men. <S%H120><s%>

"The leach <S%H5936><s%> has two <S%H8147><s%> daughters: <S%H1323><s%> <S%H3051><s%> 'Give, give. <S%H3051><s%>' "There are three <S%H7969><s%> things that are never satisfied; <S%H7646><s%> four <S%H702><s%> that <S%H559><s%> don't <S%H1952><s%> say, 'Enough:'

Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> the barren <S%H6115><s%> womb; <S%H7356><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> that is not satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with water; <S%H4325><s%> and the fire <S%H784><s%> that doesn't <S%H559><s%> say, <S%H1952><s%> 'Enough.'

"The eye <S%H5869><s%> that mocks <S%H3932><s%> at his father, <S%H1><s%> and scorns <S%H936><s%> obedience <S%H3349><s%> to his mother: <S%H517><s%> the ravens <S%H6158><s%> of the valley <S%H5158><s%> shall pick it out, <S%H5365><s%> the young <S%H1121><s%> eagles <S%H5404><s%> shall eat it. <S%H398><s%>
"There are three <S%H7969><s%> things which are too amazing <S%H6381><s%> for me, <S%H702><s%> four which I don't <S%H3045><s%> understand:

The way <S%H1870><s%> of an eagle <S%H5404><s%> in the air; <S%H8064><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> of a serpent <S%H5175><s%> on a rock; <S%H6697><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> of a ship <S%H591><s%> in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the sea; <S%H3220><s%> and the way <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H1397><s%> with a maiden. <S%H5959><s%>

"So is the way <S%H1870><s%> of an adulterous <S%H5003><s%> woman: <S%H802><s%> she eats <S%H398><s%> and wipes <S%H4229><s%> her mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and says, <S%H559><s%> <S%H6466><s%> 'I have done nothing wrong. <S%H205><s%>'
"For three <S%H7969><s%> things the earth <S%H776><s%> tremble, <S%H7264><s%> and under four, <S%H702><s%> it can't <S%H3201><s%> bear up: <S%H5375><s%>
For a servant <S%H5650><s%> when he is king; <S%H4427><s%> a fool <S%H5036><s%> when he is filled <S%H7646><s%> with food; <S%H3899><s%>
for an unloved <S%H8130><s%> woman when she is married; <S%H1166><s%> and a handmaid <S%H8198><s%> who is heir <S%H3423><s%> to her mistress. <S%H1404><s%>
"There are four <S%H702><s%> things which are little <S%H6996><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> but they are exceedingly <S%H2449><s%> wise: <S%H2450><s%>
the ants <S%H5244><s%> are not a strong <S%H5794><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> yet they provide <S%H3559><s%> their food <S%H3899><s%> in the summer. <S%H7019><s%>
The conies <S%H8227><s%> are but a feeble <S%H6099><s%> folk, <S%H5971><s%> yet make <S%H7760><s%> they their houses <S%H1004><s%> in the rocks. <S%H5553><s%>
The locusts <S%H697><s%> have no king, <S%H4428><s%> yet they advance <S%H3318><s%> in ranks. <S%H2686><s%>
You can catch <S%H8610><s%> a lizard <S%H8079><s%> with your hands, <S%H3027><s%> yet it is in kings <S%H4428><s%>' palaces. <S%H1964><s%>
"There are three <S%H7969><s%> things which are stately <S%H3190><s%> in their march, <S%H6806><s%> four <S%H702><s%> which are stately <S%H2895><s%> in going: <S%H3212><s%>
The lion, <S%H3918><s%> which is mightiest <S%H1368><s%> among animals, <S%H929><s%> and doesn't <S%H7725><s%> turn away for any; <S%H6440><s%>
the greyhound, <S%H4975><s%> the male goat <S%H8495><s%> also; <S%H176><s%> and the king <S%H4428><s%> against whom there is no rising up. <S%H510><s%>
"If you have done foolishly <S%H5034><s%> in lifting up <S%H5375><s%> yourself, <S%H2161><s%> or if you have thought evil, put your hand <S%H3027><s%> over your mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

For as the churning <S%H4330><s%> of milk <S%H2461><s%> brings forth <S%H3318><s%> butter, <S%H2529><s%> and the wringing <S%H4330><s%> of the nose <S%H639><s%> brings forth <S%H3318><s%> blood; <S%H1818><s%> so the forcing <S%H4330><s%> of wrath <S%H639><s%> brings forth <S%H3318><s%> strife. <S%H7379><s%>"
